intro: Cacalia pinnata, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with surrounding white ray florets. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows. Cacalia pinnata is adapted to arid environments and has a long blooming period, typically from spring to early summer.
